name: Contact Data
description: The CTD segment contains detailed contact information for healthcare providers, personnel, and other individuals associated with patient care, referrals, or administrative functions. This segment allows multiple contact personnel to be associated with a single provider or organization, supporting complex healthcare communication networks and referral relationships.

cardinality.note: CTD segments repeat for each contact person associated with the provider or organization

CTD.1.name: Role
CTD.1.description: This field specifies the role or relationship of the contact person to the provider or organization. Defines the functional capacity in which the contact serves within the healthcare delivery system.
CTD.1.generationHint: Most common: ATT (attending), REF (referring), CON (consultant), PRI (primary)

CTD.2.name: Contact Name
CTD.2.description: This field contains the name of the contact person. Supports various name formats including family name, given name, middle initial, suffix, and prefix components.

CTD.3.name: Contact Address
CTD.3.description: This field contains the mailing address information for the contact person. Includes street address, city, state, postal code, and country components.

CTD.4.name: Contact Location
CTD.4.description: This field specifies the physical location where the contact person can be found within a healthcare facility. Includes building, floor, room, and department information.

CTD.5.name: Contact Communication Information
CTD.5.description: This field contains telecommunication information for contacting the person, including phone numbers, fax numbers, email addresses, and other communication methods.

CTD.6.name: Preferred Method of Contact
CTD.6.description: This field indicates the preferred method for contacting this person, such as phone, email, pager, or other communication channels.
CTD.6.generationHint: Most common: O (office), C (cellular), E (email), P (pager)

CTD.7.name: Contact Identifiers
CTD.7.description: This field contains unique identifiers for the contact person, such as provider numbers, license numbers, employee IDs, or other identification codes used by the healthcare organization.
CTD.7.generationHint: Provider IDs: NPI1234567890, License: MD123456, Employee: EMP789012

notes: CTD segment is essential for healthcare communication and referral management
Role field (CTD.1) is required and defines the contact's relationship to patient care
Multiple CTD segments can be used to specify different contact persons for same provider
Contact communication information supports multiple communication channels
Preferred contact method enables efficient provider-to-provider communication
Critical for care coordination and patient safety communication workflows

dataConsistency.roleValidation: CTD.1 Role must be appropriate for the healthcare context
dataConsistency.contactMethodAlignment: CTD.6 Preferred method must reference valid communication in CTD.5
dataConsistency.identifierValidation: CTD.7 Contact identifiers must be valid for the specified role
dataConsistency.addressCompletion: CTD.3 and CTD.4 should provide sufficient location information

businessRules.communicationCompliance: All contact methods must comply with healthcare communication standards
businessRules.roleAuthorization: Contact roles must be appropriate for the provider's scope of practice
businessRules.identifierValidation: Provider identifiers must be properly verified and current
businessRules.contactVerification: Contact information should be validated for accuracy and accessibility

messageFlow.workflow: CTD segments enable comprehensive provider contact management and care coordination
